com.yantra.api.ycm

Interface getItemAssociations

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi

    public interface getItemAssociations

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getItemAssociations(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getItemAssociations API returns a list of all items associated with a given item.

    • Method Detail

      • getItemAssociations

        org.w3c.dom.Document getItemAssociations(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getItemAssociations API returns a list of all items associated with a given item.

        Catalog Management supports making an association between two or more items. There are different types of associations that can be made such as cross-sell, up-sell, or substitution associations. If AssociationType is not specified, the getItemAssociations API returns items for all the association types. The getItemAssociations API returns association details such as the dates when this association is in effect.

        For example, a particular shirt can be associated as a cross-sell with a tie. When the shirt is ordered by a customer the associated tie cross-sell may be displayed as an option.

        By default, the getItemAssociations API only returns item associations for items that are in Published status. If the getUnpublishedItems attribute is passed as Y in the input XML, item associations for items in any status are returned.

        It is also possible to associate an item with a specific query in Catalog Management. This supports associating an item to a set of items that match some query criteria that are specified. If the ExecuteQueries attribute is passed as Y in the input XML, the getItemAssociations API also returns the list of items that match the criteria given in all queries that have been associated with the given item.

        Note: If an item is associated with a specific query, specify the quantity to associate in the output XML. Otherwise, the getItemAssociations API returns a value of 0.

        The getItemAssociations API calls the com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemAssociationsUE user exit so access to the details of item associations can be externalized.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemAssociationsUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains a list of associated items. For details on the output, refer to the associated output xml files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
